headline.main: Cost of War --The Campaigns of Mexico and the Crimea.

docs.lead_paragraph: It was stated its our last paper, in a review of the Budget of the English Chancellor of the Exchequer, that the three items of Army, Navy and Ordnance, cost the British Government in 1854 the round sum of one hundred and fifty millions of dollars, and that the same items for the first quarter of 1855 cost an outlay of $08.300.000.

docs.lead_paragraph: SECOND DAY. A number of members of the Association arrived last evening, thus causing the meeting to be very fully attended this morning. A few minutes after 9 o'clock, the President, Dr. CHARLES A. POPE, of St. Louis, took the Chair.
docs.snippet: SECOND DAY. A number of members of the Association arrived last evening, thus causing the meeting to be very fully attended this morning. A few minutes after 9 o'clock, the President, Dr. CHARLES A. POPE, of St. Louis, took the Chair.

headline.main: THE WAR.; The long-talked of General Bombardment of Sebastopol Begun!

docs.lead_paragraph: Fire from all the French and English batteries was opened upon Sebastopol on the 9th. On the 10th both French and English viewed the bombardment as effective; but nothing decisive had occurred to warrant a conclusion as to the immediate issue.
docs.snippet: Fire from all the French and English batteries was opened upon Sebastopol on the 9th. On the 10th both French and English viewed the bombardment as effective; but nothing decisive had occurred to warrant a conclusion as to the immediate issue.

headline.main: THREE DAYS LATER FROM HAVANA.; ARRIVAL OF THE BLACK WARRIOR. docs.lead_paragraph: The U. S. Mail steamer Black Warrior, J. D. BULLOCK, commander, arrived yesterday morning. She brings 132 passengers, and a heavy freight. She left Havana on the 28th. The U. S. steamer San Jacinto was in port.
docs.snippet: The U. S. Mail steamer Black Warrior, J. D. BULLOCK, commander, arrived yesterday morning. She brings 132 passengers, and a heavy freight. She left Havana on the 28th. The U. S. steamer San Jacinto was in port.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Chicago Journal makes the following story public for the terror of evil doers: "A man named BILLON, living at Galena, of considerable wealth and very respectably connected, has been in the habit, for years past, of maltreating his wife and family in the most brutal manner.

ONE WEEK LATER FROM CALIFORNIA.; Arrival of the Steamship Star of the West. $300,000 ON FREIGHT. GENERAL SUMMARY OF NEWS. THE MARKETS, &c. CALIFORNIA. The News of the Week. Rejection of the Religious Test by the California Know-Nothings. The Funding Bill. The Temperance Movement.. Adams & Co.--Nomination of Assignees. The Loss of The W. T. Wheaton. Mining News. Southern California. California Markets. Marriages and Deaths. MARRIED. DIED.

docs.lead_paragraph: The steamship Star of the West, of the Nicaragua Line, E. W. TURNER, Commmander, arrived last evening from Punta Arenas, via Key West, with 517 passengers and $300,000 in specie on freight. The stir of the West arrived outward at Punta Arenas on the 22d ult., connecting with the steamship Uncle Sam, Lieut. C. H. BALDWIN, Commander, which left San Francisco on the 9th inst. docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor of the New-York Daily Times: A contemporary, who is manifestly fond of interposing its editorial dicta against law and history, yesterday announced that the sale of liquor was a nuisance at common law, and never was unrestricted. Not being desirous of placing our wise forefathers in the light of having for many ages licensed a nuisance, and having some respect for history upon the subject, we venture a dissent.
